revised_title: Influence of Motor Innervation on Mammalian Skeletal Muscle Plasticity
tldr: The article discusses the plasticity in mammalian skeletal muscles and how motor innervation influences their contractile properties and biochemical changes. By altering the peripheral nerve innervating a skeletal muscle, the contractile behavior of the reinnervated muscle can be dramatically changed. The number and pattern of motor nerve impulses play an important role in determining the nature of a muscle fiber's contractile machinery. This plasticity can be observed through changes in the time to peak and half relaxation time of muscle contractions.
